block.p: Christiane Marie Mahoney, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David J. Mahoney of Upper Saddle River, N.J., was married yesterday to James Edgar Pew, a son of Sally Chinn Pew and George L. Pew Jr. of Villanova, Pa. The Rev. Giles Spoonhour performed the ceremony at St. George's Episcopal Church in New York.
Mrs. Pew, 32, is a marketing manager for Autodesk, a computer software development company in San Rafael, Calif. She graduated from Villanova University.

Christiane Marie Mahoney, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David J. Mahoney of Upper Saddle River, N.J., was married yesterday to James Edgar Pew, a son of Sally Chinn Pew and George L. Pew Jr. of Villanova, Pa. The Rev. Giles Spoonhour performed the ceremony at St. George's Episcopal Church in New York.
Mrs. Pew, 32, is a marketing manager for Autodesk, a computer software development company in San Rafael, Calif. She graduated from Villanova University.

The bride's father, who retired as a senior counsel in New York for the Exxon Corporation, is a senior partner in Waters, McPherson & McNeill, a law firm in Secaucus, N.J. Her mother, Margaret G. Mahoney, is a real estate agent in the Saddle River, N.J., office of Coldwell Banker.

Mr. Pew, 34, is known as Edgar. He is a computer software product developer at the Lawgic Publishing Company in Novato, Calif. He graduated from Yale University and received a law degree from Columbia University.

His mother was until 1996 a trustee of Planned Parenthood of Southeastern Pennsylvania. His father, a former management consultant, is the vice chairman of the Independence Seaport Museum in Philadelphia and a trustee of the Island Institute, a conservation organization in Rockland, Me.
